name: SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Ensure latest revision is being used

TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Prior to works, updated accordingly based on
formal correspondence
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Controlled IFC drawings being used – Checkpoint on QA
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO – Detailed Design Report - NAL CH 128.84km: Section 5

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: The contractor is responsible for protecting earthworks and erosion control measures, and must develop a site-specific Environmental Control Plan (ESCP) that KiwiRail must review before construction begins.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Contractor to ensure effective erosion and sedimentation control measures shall be installed and maintained in accordance with Auckland Council Resource Consent
Requirements, and the ESCP.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Before construction begins
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: ESCP Documentation, Photos, Daily and Weekly Audits
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO – Detailed Design Report - NAL CH 128.84km: Section 6

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: An ecologist from KiwiRail must be consulted and on-site to assess the site before and during the removal of vegetation and trees in a Significant Environmental
Area (SEA).
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The contractor to collaborate with the appointed ecologist from KiwiRail and adhere to the proposed controls.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Before and during the removal of vegetation and trees in a Significant Environmental Area (SEA).
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Written Confirmation of the Ecologist’s Instructions and Approval, Photos
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO – NAL CH 128.84km: Drawing 7 Note 2

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: A pre-start meeting with Engineer and Contractor is needed to ensure understanding of construction methodology, review work plan and methodology for Geotechnical Professional,
and ensure safety measures are in place.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Construction methodology agreed between Contractor and Engineer
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of works
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: RFI for Clarity and record purposes

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: All materials as per the design drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All materials comply with the drawings
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Prior to use of materials on site
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Dockets
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO – NAL CH 128.84km: Drawing 4
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Bedding thickness min. 200mm GAP20

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer to confirm GAP 20 compacted to 90% MDD
or
CIV of 20 with Clegg Impact Hammer (in accordance with
NZS 3725:2007)
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Engineer to check prior to installation of manhole and pipe
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: NDM and or Clegg Test Results, Photos, QA Checksheet(s), Written Confirmation of Engineer’s Approval
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO – NAL CH 128.84km: Drawing 5 & Drawing 7 Note 1
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: SP20 Compacted in 150mm layers to widest pipe width
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer to confirm SP20 compacted to at least 90% MDD
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Engineer to check every 150mm thick compacted layer
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: NDM Test Results, Photos, QA Checksheet(s), Written Confirmation of Engineer’s Approval
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO – NAL CH 128.84km: Drawing 5 & Drawing 7 Note 1

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Backfill to comprise of GAP65 or geotechnically approved material in max.
200mm lifts

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer to confirm GAP65 or GAP40 or PAP40 or PAP 65 approved equivalent compacted to 95% MDD at interface of sub- ballast layer (in accordance with NZS 3725:2007) – for (sub-ballast refer formation items). Subballast layer to be GAP40 compacted to 98% MDD or Clegg of 30.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Engineer to check every 200mm thick compacted layer
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: NDM Results, Photos, QA Checksheet(s), Written Confirmation of Engineer’s Approval
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Undercut where subgrade is < 70kpa as measured by hand held shear vane

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Installed per RFI 027 detail : 300mm ballast, A29 geotextile wrapped. Duragrid 30/30 or TX160 between wrap and
bedding backfill.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Check Subgrade every 3 pipe lengths (approx. 7.5m)
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Check sheets, photos
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO – NAL CH 128.84km: Drawing 5
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Compacted hardfill min 200mm thk
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Engineer to confirm SP20 compacted to at least 95% MDD
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Engineer to check every 150mm thick compacted layer
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: NDM Test Results, Photos, QA Checksheet(s), Written Confirmation of Engineer’s Approval
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO – NAL CH 128.84km: Drawing 5 & Drawing 7 Note 2
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Drainage works to be installed in accordance with the design drawings.

TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Engineer to check prior to backfill of drainage items

name: DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO – Detailed Design Report - NAL CH 128.84km: Section 7
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: The slope will be revegetated using native hydroseeding, native shrub planting, or a combination of both, approved by a KiwiRail environmental scientist and ecologist.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Revegetation planting comply with KiwiRail approved corridor planting schedule 2023.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Shrubs to be approved by KiwiRail environmental scientist and ecologist before planting or seeding.

CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: List of native shrub, Written Confirmation from KiwiRail Environmental
Specialist
